title: Distinguished System Design Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 Sandisk understands how people and businesses consume data and we relentlessly innovate to deliver solutions that enable today’s needs and tomorrow’s next big ideas. With a rich history of groundbreaking innovations in Flash and advanced memory technologies, our solutions have become the beating heart of the digital world we’re living in and that we have the power to shape.
   

  

 Sandisk meets people and businesses at the intersection of their aspirations and the moment, enabling them to keep moving and pushing possibility forward. We do this through the balance of our powerhouse manufacturing capabilities and our industry\\-leading portfolio of products that are recognized globally for innovation, performance and quality.
   

  

 Sandisk has two facilities recognized by the World Economic Forum as part of the Global Lighthouse Network for advanced 4IR innovations. These facilities were also recognized as Sustainability Lighthouses for breakthroughs in efficient operations. With our global reach, we ensure the global supply chain has access to the Flash memory it needs to keep our world moving forward.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Proficient in Storage system architecture especially with UFS,eMMC and Automotive products
* Expert in defining UFS/eMMC controller architecture for embedded and automotive solutions , in depth knowledge in
* Expert in defining embedded NAND features and system handling etc
* Should be expert in defining PPA (power ,perf and area) optimized solutions for storage products
* Good have good communication skills and collaborative skills to work with customers, partners and eco system etc
* Protocol expertise \\- working knowledge in UFS, eMMC , NVMe protocols etc
* Innovation \\- Good track record of innovation and new ideas/papers in external forums etc
* Should be able to lead team ( internal/external) and bring best out of the team
* Expertise in performance analysis, power optimization ,yield improvement and HW debug capability etc
* Must be Good team player ,collaborative and result oriented with product first mindset


**Qualifications**
 BE/ME with 15\\+ years of relevant experience in Storage system architecture or Storage Firmware Architecture development ,preferably with UFS/iNAND domain
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Sandisk thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
   

  

 Sandisk is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@sandisk.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Company: GoodSpace AI
 



 Location: Remote
 



 Compensation: ₹6\\-9 LPA
 



 Experience: 0 – 3 years
 



 Type: Full\\-time
 



  





 About GoodSpace AI:
 



 GoodSpace AI is redefining how companies hire. Our AI\\-driven recruitment platform helps founders and HR teams find, evaluate, and hire qualified talent within 24 hours — eliminating the need for endless screening and manual interviews.
 



 We’re a fast\\-growing startup backed by strong technology and passionate people who believe in making hiring 10x faster and smarter.
 



  





 Role Overview:
 



 We’re looking for a Software Engineer to join our core product team and help us build scalable, intelligent systems that power our AI recruitment engine. You’ll work on real problems — from automating candidate evaluation to building AI\\-driven matching pipelines — while contributing to a modern, high\\-performance product stack.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 



 \\-Design, build, and maintain scalable APIs and microservices for our AI hiring platform.

 \\-Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and feature planning.

 What You’ll Need:

 Why Join Us:

 If you love building scalable systems, working with AI technologies, and solving real\\-world challenges — we’d love to meet you.

title: AppScan Product _Sr. Performance Engineer _Remote Location
description:
Greetings from "HCL Software"
 



  





 "HCL Software”: \\- Is a Product Development Division of HCL Tech: That operates its primary Software business. At HCL Software we Develop, Market, Sell and Support over 20 Product families in the areas of Customer Experience, Digital Solutions, Secure DevOps, Security \\& Automation.
 



  





 About AppScan Product:
 



 HCL AppScan is a comprehensive suite of application security solutions for developers, DevOps, security teams and CISOs, with on\\-premises, on cloud, and hybrid deployment options. The suite includes various security tools that offer features such as vulnerability scanning, code analysis, and real\\-time threat detection, providing significant benefits in protecting software applications throughout their lifecycle.
 



  





**Role summary** 




 Hiring a hands\\-on Performance Engineer for AppScan Enterprise (on\\-prem: Liberty \\+ IIS servers, agent machines, DB server, containerised target apps). You’ll own load, stress, soak, spike and scalability testing; maintain the perf lab fully; automate test execution and environment setup; systematically compare performance against established baselines and trace regressions to specific component changes; debug performance degradations at Liberty, IIS, DB, agent, or container layers with minimal handoffs.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 



**Performance testing \\& analysis** 



* Design \\& run load, stress, soak, spike tests across ASE stack (Liberty \\+ IIS \\+ agents \\+ DB \\+ containerised targets).
* Compare current results with baseline metrics; detect regressions, produce clear RCA, and tune Liberty JVM / IIS / DB / agent / container settings.
* Define SLAs, benchmarks, and capacity targets for all components.



**Perf lab \\& environment management** 



* Install, upgrade, patch ASE components: server VM, agents, DB server, Liberty \\& IIS servers, plus the containerised targets.
* Maintain versioned, reproducible setups (VMs, containers, configs) to ensure consistent and comparable test runs.
* Ensure environmental isolation and stability to prevent drift or inconsistencies between runs.



**Automation \\& DevOps for perf lab** 



* Automate installation, patching, environment provisioning and teardown with scripts/tools suited for on\\-prem Windows \\+ Liberty environments.
* Build pipelines for scheduled test runs, results gathering, automated reporting, and alerting.



**Monitoring, observability \\& RCA** 



* Capture telemetry: Liberty metrics (JVM / feature load), IIS counters, agent logs, DB performance metrics, container logs \\& traces under load.
* Use monitoring, tracing, metrics and logs to isolate configuration, code, resource or agent related bottlenecks; deliver reproducible root cause diagnostics.



**Collaboration \\& delivery** 



* Collaborate with Dev, QA, and Product teams to ensure performance considerations are built into design; produce fixes with clear repro steps and measurable improvements.
* Share best practices for ASE\\-specific performance testing, lab setup/maintenance, baseline\\-regression approaches, and automation hygiene.



 Required skills \\& experience (must\\-have)
 


* 6\\-10\\+ years in performance engineering ; Automation, site reliability ; DevOs with hands\\-on experience in on\\-prem Windows \\+ Liberty \\+ IIS environments \\+ SQL DB.
* Strong experience with load/stress test tools (e.g. JMeter, k6, Gatling) in multi\\-component setups.
* Solid scripting skills (PowerShell, Python, or Bash) for ASE installs/patching, lab setup, and test orchestration.
* Deep experience tuning and debugging Liberty JVM, IIS configuration, DB server, agents, and containerised target apps.
* Proven ability to use telemetry / observability tools (metrics, logs, traces) under load for baseline comparison \\& regression RCA.

title: AEP Developer
description:
**Summary:** 




 We are seeking an experienced Adobe Experience Platform professional to lead the implementation and ongoing ownership of Adobe solutions. This role combines deep technical expertise with strategic thinking to transform how we understand and engage with our prospects and clients across their entire journey.
 



 The Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) expert will be responsible for hands\\-on implementation of Real\\-Time CDP (RTCDP), including data ingestion pipelines, XDM schema development, identity stitching, and activation enablement. This role focuses on technical execution, ensuring data integrity, privacy compliance, and operational excellence.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Serve as the primary AEP/RTCDP subject matter expert, advising on end\\-to\\-end architecture, governance, scalability, and best practices.
* Define and build data models (XDM schemas), datasets, mappings, and identity strategies (namespaces, stitching rules, profile merge policies) to power high\\-quality customer profiles and segmentation.
* Plan and implement data ingestion pipelines (batch, streaming via Edge Network, Web/Mobile SDKs, APIs) using AEP Sources, Data Prep, and Transformation capabilities.
* Administer AEP sandboxes, product profiles, roles, and permissions (via Admin Console/AEP) to enforce least\\-privilege access controls.
* Create and maintain solution documentation: dataflow diagrams, identity maps, schema catalogues, destination activation models, and runbooks.
* Build segmentation strategies (Edge, streaming, batch) and orchestrate activation to AEP destinations (adtech, Adobe campaign, Target, CRM, custom destinations/APIs).
* Architect Federated Audience Composition (FAC) and federated data access patterns to enable cross\\-system audience building and governed data usage.
* Align AEP/RTCDP implementation with enterprise data governance and global privacy policies (GDPR, CCPA, etc.).
* Integrate with Adobe Launch, Adobe Analytics, Journey Optimizer, Campaign, Target, Analytics to deliver omni\\-stack use cases etc
* Support QA, deployment, and troubleshooting during implementation cycles.



**Required Qualifications:** 



* 5–10 years in MarTech, data engineering, or technology architecture; including 4\\+ years hands\\-on with Adobe RTCDP/AEP.
* Strong skills in APIs, SDKs, ETL/ELT pipelines, and data transformations.
* Proficiency in SQL, Python, JavaScript for data processing and SDK instrumentation.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms and data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
* Knowledge of privacy and consent policies (GDPR, CCPA).
* Excellent analytical, problem\\-solving, documentation, communication, collaboration, and client\\-facing consulting skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.
* Certified expert on Adobe solutions(AEP RTCDP, Analytics, Target, Campaign) will be a plus
